Job description

The Planning and Projects Manager is a forward thinking strategic leadership role designed for an inspiring collaborative leader. The purpose of the role is to help shape YMCA Victoria to ensure we have maximum impact through robust and agile planning that delivers high social impact and is well evaluated and understood across all levels of the organisation. The role will also ensure YMCA Victoria has a strong Project Framework that is applied across all areas of the organisation.


Key Selection Criteria (all criteria must be addressed in a cover letter)

  1. Demonstrated experience in leading the development, implementation, evaluation and ongoing improvement of planning systems.​
  2. Solid understanding and demonstrated experience in Project Management methodology
  3. Strong coaching and mentoring style that builds capability and confidence in others
  4. Highly organised with attention to detail, high level planning and time management skills.

Qualifications

  • Minimum 5 years Management Experience in related field
  • Working With Children Check
  • Safeguarding Children and Young People Certificate (completion online prior to commencement)

    • \xa0

Project Manager - HCM

Company Name Halcyon Knights - Tech & Executive Talent Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 73 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

My client has a pivotal role within the Victorian public sector and is consistently looking to deliver accountability and outcomes across government bodies to better outcomes for the community.

A great opportunity to deliver a change initiative, this business is currently due to embark on a new Human Capital Management (HCM) system implementation project and need an experienced Project Manager to deliver a successful implementation. This role is a 12-month fixed term contract.

This role will see you responsible for the following, but not limited to:


  • Project management of the HCM implementation project
  • Work with the project team to scope requirements and develop the project plan
  • Track budgets, milestones and project reporting requirements ensuring they align with schedule
  • Build superb internal and external relationships, developing, mentoring, influencing and informing delivery and operational teams, C-Suite, vendors
  • Identify any resourcing requirements to ensure talent needed and delivery schedule is met
  • Strong business engagement skills and a focus on stakeholder engagement
  • Ensure vendor is meeting deadlines and manage the communication process, manage workflow

Skills required:


  • An advanced ability (and proven experience) in navigating HR/HCM implementation projects (SuccessFactors would be advantageous)
  • Well developed communication and influencing skills - strong stakeholder and vendor management ability
  • Proven diverse project management background in system implementation - end to end
  • Project Management certifications would be highly looked upon also.

If this sounds like you, please apply below by attaching your resume and a cover letter highlighting your strengths in line with the requirements mentioned above! Or alternatively email your resume and cover letter to Kara Porter - karap@halcyonknights.com.au. ONLY shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

For other exciting job opportunities and to keep up-to-date with the IT world, please 'Follow' Halcyon Knights on LinkedIn @ www.linkedin.com/company/halcyon-knights.

Software Engineers

Company Name Company Location 120 Collins Street , Melbourne, VIC 3006, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

BetEasy is the most sophisticated and rewarding wagering operator in its class. Built on a powerful partnership with The Stars Group, we are well on our journey to be the number one wagering operator by 2020, delivered through excellent people, process and technology within an innovative and dynamic culture.
\xa0
To help us on our journey we’re looking for Software Engineers\xa0to join our mission teams and deliver a range of solutions using emerging technologies as well as facilitating ongoing enhancements to existing software. You will play a key role in the architecture of solutions delivered to the business, and will be involved throughout the stages of software development process, including consultation with stakeholders, design, implementation, testing, release and post-implementation support and maintenance.

More about the ROLE:
  • Agile – Teams are given the autonomy to come up with solutions & how they deliver independently in cross-functional teams
  • Rapid Frontends – We’re in the process of breaking apart our website into CI/CD driven deployable components, owned & supported by the team who built them
  • DevOps - Creating, supporting, and monitoring the infrastructure we deploy using Amazon Web Services. All our infrastructure & deployment scripts are built, versioned & maintained by our engineers. We release multiple times a day, and our teams support their own software
  • A champion for continuous improvements & knowledge sharing within your team & the wider practice
\xa0
About YOU:
We’re looking for Engineers with a real passion for software design and development practices. If you’ve an active interest in the latest technologies and architectural trends then check out the details below and if they apply to you then please send us your application today!

Technical Skills
  • At least 3-5 years’ experience JavaScript (including ES6) & Web development
  • At least 2 years’ experience with a client-side JavaScript Framework (We use React, but any modern JS framework will do)
  • Experience building on & deploying to a cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP etc.)
  • Highly proficient with responsive web development; cross-browser and device agnostic
Core Competencies:
  • Collaborate effectively with your teammates; Taking & giving constructive feedback
  • Articulate technical challenges to both technical & non-technical milestones.
  • Break down complex technical/product initiative into lean deliverable milestones
  • An understanding of the value & challenges in implementing Continuous Integration/Delivery
  • Experience in agile methodologies and its application to the development process
  • A proven track record of delivering the best solution for the task at hand, not just building the solution expected/requested
  • Strong understanding of digital landscape, including web and mobile and experience integrating systems using different technologies, protocols and API’s.


If you’re passionate about designing elegant solutions that are at the bleeding edge then this is the role for you. In return for your hard work we have a number of benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to 5 weeks’ annual leave, Lunch ‘n’ Learn sessions, matched charity donations, the MYKI commuter club and, as the official wagering partner to the AFL, there are heaps of opportunities to catch a game or two!

Why BetEasy?

BetEasy was recognised as an Employer of Choice by The Australian Business Awards 2017. With teams in Darwin, Melbourne and Sydney, we’re passionate about what we do and proud of our unique heritage and entrepreneurial spirit. We work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that push the limits of our customers' expectations. With brilliant minds and a vibrant culture, the sky’s the limit! Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

To find more about BetEasy please visit https://workatbeteasy.com.au/

Disclaimer: BetEasy does not accept unsolicited agency resumes.

838213403:
[

Risk Manager - Quality, Audit and Risk

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 54 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time, ongoing
  • Location: Dandenong
  • Award-winning community education and training provider based in Melbourne's South East


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer more than 400 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

The Manager, Risk is accountable and responsible for the development and implementation of the Institute’s Business Risk & Continuity strategy, framework and business process.

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Focus on the integration of risk management policies, procedures and business processes to ensure that a culture of risk management and business continuity is embedded within the Institute.
  • Drive a risk-aware culture where staff members are encouraged to adopt a positive and proactive approach to risk management and business continuity and ensure that an integrated, auditable and robust business risk and continuity framework is developed, adopted, maintained, and adhered to across the Institute.
  • Execute risk management and internal audit plans within the budget parameters, and provide recommendations for efficiency gains or additional resources where appropriate.
  • Provide visibility and reporting to Executives on the critical components and readiness of the plans and procedures.
  • Lead and coach the Risk and Business Continuity champions to develop best practice within the Institute.


About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualification or demonstrated experience in risk management and governance frameworks. In addition an understanding of the TAFE, Non Senior Secondary and Higher Education and an appreciation of the factors that influence the sector will assist you in being successful in the role.

Crucial to your success will a strong working knowledge of the Australian and New Zealand Standard AS/NZS ISO 31000:2009 Risk Management. With an ability to communicate with various stakeholders and influence change, you will be a key member of the Quality Audit & Risk Team in achieving Chisholm’s 2020 Vision commitment.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications for this position close 5pm Monday 10th September 2018.

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees


Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • valid Employee Working With Children Check
  • National Police Check
  • International Police Check (if applicable)
  • verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate
  • certified copies of qualifications


If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact Geoffrey Hardwicke, Manager – Quality, Audit and Risk +61 3 9212 5151.

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Higher Education
  • Education Management

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Finance
  • Sales

Regulatory Affairs Officer - Medical devices

Company Name OLYMPUS AUSTRALIA and NEW ZEALAND Company Location Notting Hill, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 77 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


We have an exciting opportunity for a Regulatory Affairs Officer, based in Notting Hill, Melbourne. Reporting to the Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring Olympus' ongoing compliance against regulatory requirements for Olympus Australia and Olympus New Zealand.

The Regulatory Affairs officer will play an integral role in pursuit of the Quality and Regulatory mission to:

  • Partner and collaborate with the OAZ business and manufacturers as an expert advisor to deliver diligent and considered outcomes
  • Guide stakeholders, leveraging requirements, structures and standards for sustained growth and success
  • Safeguard operations by implementing controls and measures
  • Embed regulatory principles and considerations into all employees day to day activities


Looking after you:
We are committed to ensuring our people are well looked after. In addition to a rewarding and challenging career, we will provide you with:

  • Ongoing world class technical training;
  • Competitive package including performance based incentives and annual review;
  • Access to our various development programs;
  • Participation in our Reward and Recognition Program 'Shining Stars';
  • Access to our Purchased Annual Leave Program; and
  • Discounts off a large range of Olympus cameras.


All about you:
You will have direct work experience with extensive medical device requirements or relevant work experience with the TGA/Medsafe as well as a working knowledge of ISO 9001:2015 requirements. You will have excellent communication skills for liaising with manufacturers, Olympus staff and external stakeholders and a tertiary qualification would be highly regarded.

Finally, you have well-developed process, analysis, problem identification and business improvement skills.

Interstate or travel to New Zealand may be required

Your environment:
At Olympus, we are focused on creating a great organisational culture and a collaborative environment that enables everyone to Shine as a team and as an individual.

Our common values of Integrity, Empathy, Long-Term View, Agility and Unity form the foundation of our culture and guide our behaviour - empowering us. This is how we make people's lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling.

For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please contact Emma Lucas on +61 3 9265 5404 or apply now. To view a copy of the Position Description, please visit our company careers page: www.olympusaustralia.com.au.
No Agency assistance required at this time.
Olympus Australia & New Zealand is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Social Inclusion Officer

Company Name Cardinia Shire Council Company Location Cardinia, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



  • Max term till June 2019
  • Part Time - 0.6 EFT ( 22.8hrs per week)
  • Band 5 (Salary Range $64K -$ 79K pro-rata + super)
  • Highly supportive team
  • Work in an amazing Activity Based Working environment

Are you looking for an opportunity to make a difference to our growing ageing community?

Reporting to the Coordinator Ageing Well you will support the implementation of the Council’s Age Friendly Strategy. Your role will be to champion ageing well in Cardinia Shire by implementing a number of key actions aligned with our commitment as a World Health Organisation Age Friendly City.

To be considered for this role you will need to have experience in;

  • Health promotion and the application of community development principles and practices as they relate to older people
  • Supporting the development of, and implementing an Age Friendly Strategy & Policy or equivalent
  • Experience in collaborating and building relationships with stakeholders, agencies/government departments to achieve actions in the Cardinia Shire Council Age Friendly Strategy or equivalent.
  • Experience working with community organisations to identify health and wellbeing issues in the aged population and help build the capacity of organisations/partners to find local solutions.
  • The role is based at the Cardinia Civic Centre in Officer, Victoria, an exciting new workspace in the heart of one of Melbourne’s most dynamic and innovative municipalities. We are an organisation that embraces Activity Based Working, and as such we seek staff with demonstrated ability to show flexibility and adaptability in a work context.
  • A Tertiary qualification in Health Promotion, Social Sciences, Community Development or another relevant discipline is desired.

Why Cardinia?

Here are some reasons why people love it at Cardinia:

  • The people -we really live the values. We look out for each other (like a team) and we are genuine.
  • We work in the best workplace in local government – Activity Based Working – the office space and opportunities for just being you, and collaborative, are endless.
  • Lots of other perks; like health & wellbeing program, extensive professional development programs and support, and much more.
  • We embrace action oriented people who aren’t afraid to challenge the norm.
  • What we’re building in this shire exciting and will leave a legacy, and you get to directly influence it.
  • Our Leadership team are amazing - passionate as well as engaging and approachable.

For more information view copy of position description. Enquiries to Annmarie Saffin on 03 5943 4488

To apply, complete the online application form below. You will be required to respond to the key selection criteria and upload your resume and cover letter.

All successful applicants will be required to undertake a National Police Check, pre-employment medical and obtain or hold a valid Working With Children Check.

Applications close Wednesday 5 September 2018 11.30pm

Cardinia Shire Council is an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer who supports inclusiveness and diversity. We welcome applications from people from a diverse background, including but not limited to, those identifying as LGBTIQ, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, people from cultural and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, and people with a disability

Manager, Service & Operations

Company Name Omnicell Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 105 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Manager, Service and Operations

The Manager of Service and Operations APAC is responsible for providing leadership, guidance and customer support to the entire APAC operations organization and its customers. This role will report to the General Manager of APAC and will support the achievement of all operational and commercial business objectives by ensuring that end-user customer satisfaction goals are met, service contract terms are being fulfilled and all internal financial and regulatory requirements are met. This position will be responsible for managing service delivery within the region in concert with peer management staff and commercial leaders. This role will support commercial business objectives and will serve as a senior point of escalation for all matters relating to service and customer support for the region. This position will act as the primary revenue driver to the Omnicell field operations team in the region.


Essential Functions:

  • Lead the execution of the service and operations strategy in APAC.
  • Deliver on revenue and profitability plans through fulfillment of service contracts and implementation of product.
  • Develop strong working relationships directly with Omnicell business partners and customers and execute initiatives to maximize customer and brand loyalty.
  • Manage the performance of the installed base of equipment and the development of continuous improvement plans.
  • Develop and lead a highly effective team of Service and Operations professionals including employee development, staffing plans, training, efficiency, while minimizing turnover. \xa0
  • Provide leadership to ensure that all financial business objectives are met across the service P/L. Develop, analyze and drive business improvement initiatives related to resource deployment, cost control measures and process improvements in concert with field-based service leadership teams, global service and other headquarters-based support functions.
  • Provide guidance and support to other support functions within the region including: Service Operations, Project Management, Installation, Technical and Clinical Support as well as other global support functions including but not limited to: Finance, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Quality/Regulatory and Engineering.
  • Actively participate in regional meetings and strategic planning sessions as appropriate.
  • Responsible for training programs for all APAC business partners with respect to new and enhanced products and software releases
  • Responsible for scheduling manufacture and shipment of all new purchase orders of Omnicell equipment post booking stage and work with business partners to manage arrangements efficiently to meet required timelines.


Required Knowledge and Skills:

  • Degree in Science or Engineering
  • 10+ years of experience working in the areas of operations and service management within the healthcare field
  • Strong ability to guide and influence customers and internal resources
  • Must communicate effectively and provide weekly reporting to regional management
  • Effective manager of own time and schedule.
  • Ability to work in a changing and demanding environment.
  • Ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues and negotiate consensus effectively.
  • Committed to continuous learning and ability to develop an in-depth understanding of the product.
  • Customer satisfaction advocate
  • Fluent in English with other language skills an advantage.


Additional Desired Knowledge and Skills:

  • Willingness to travel within region and International as business requires
  • Previous experience within the hospital and healthcare environment
  • PMP certification or strong understanding of PM concepts
  • Has a strong understanding of automation and Healthcare IT concepts


Work Conditions:

~30% international travel

Lifting of items weighing 20kg or more

Working on construction sites and over weekends as required
